title: High Self-Employment Rates
description: In 2023, 94.54% of the total employment in the Central African Republic was self-employed, with 97.59% of women and 91.68% of men working for themselves.

title: Elevated Vulnerable Employment
description: As of 2023, 93.32% of the workforce in the Central African Republic was in vulnerable employment, with 96.80% of women and 90.06% of men affected.

title: High Pupil-Teacher Ratio in Primary Education
description: In 2016, the pupil-teacher ratio in primary education was 83.41, indicating a significant challenge in providing quality education.

title: Significant Maternal Mortality Risk
description: In 2023, the lifetime risk of maternal death was 4.24%, highlighting serious health challenges for women.

title: High Adolescent Fertility Rate
description: The adolescent fertility rate in 2023 was 163.09 births per 1,000 women aged 15-19, reflecting early childbearing trends.

title: High Birth Rate
description: In 2023, the crude birth rate was 46.36 per 1,000 people, indicating a rapidly growing population.

title: High Rate of Early Marriage
description: In 2019, 61% of women aged 20-24 were married by age 18, with 25.8% married by age 15, indicating prevalent early marriage practices.

title: High Age Dependency Ratio
description: The age dependency ratio in 2023 was 105.18%, with a young dependency ratio of 100.88%, suggesting a high burden on the working-age population.

title: High Mortality Rate from Air Pollution
description: In 2019, the mortality rate attributed to air pollution was 305.1 per 100,000 population, with 364.9 per 100,000 males affected.

title: High Share of Tariff Lines with International Peaks
description: In 2022, 81.78% of tariff lines for primary products had international peaks, indicating high trade barriers.

title: High Intentional Homicide Rate for Females
description: In 2016, the intentional homicide rate for females was 10.62 per 100,000, reflecting significant safety concerns.

title: Lowest Human Capital Index
description: In 2020, the Central African Republic had a Human Capital Index of 0.29, indicating one of the lowest levels of human capital development globally.

title: Limited Internet Access
description: As of 2019, only 7.51% of the population in the Central African Republic had access to the internet, highlighting significant digital connectivity challenges.

title: Low Female Literacy Rate
description: In 2020, the literacy rate for young females aged 15-24 was just 29.11%, reflecting substantial educational barriers for women.

title: Minimal Access to Safe Drinking Water
description: Only 6.13% of the population had access to safely managed drinking water services in 2022, indicating severe water safety issues.

title: High Maternal Mortality Risk
description: In 2023, the lifetime risk of maternal death was 1 in 24, one of the highest risks globally.

title: Low Survival to Age 65
description: The survival rate to age 65 for females was 7.90% and for males was 0.32% in 2022, indicating significant health challenges.

title: Limited Wage Employment Opportunities
description: In 2023, only 5.46% of the total employment was in wage and salaried jobs, reflecting limited formal employment opportunities.

title: Low Quality of Labor Regulations
description: The quality of labor regulations scored 45.90 in 2024, indicating challenges in labor market efficiency.

title: Operational Efficiency in Financial Services
description: In 2024, the operational efficiency of receiving financial services scored 15.77, highlighting inefficiencies in the financial sector.

title: Challenges in International Trade
description: The overall score for international trade was 34.44 in 2024, indicating significant barriers to trade.
